meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

I'm thrilled to be reviewing Horizon Chase 2, the latest installment in the beloved arcade racing series. As someone who's always up for a speed run (pun intended), I was stoked to dive back into the world of high-octane racing and nostalgic vibes. But before we get started, let me just say that I'm no professional reviewer like those fancy-pants folks over at IGN Spain or PlayStation Universe – I mean, have you seen their scores? Like, what even is a 90 out of 100?! That's some next-level critique right there!

Okay, okay, enough about that. On to Horizon Chase 2! This game is all about that sweet, sweet speed – and boy does it deliver. From the get-go, I was hooked on the sense of velocity (see what I did there?), zipping around tracks with reckless abandon as if I were a groovy '80s kid trying to beat my high score at the local arcade.

But what really sets Horizon Chase 2 apart is its attention to detail – or rather, attention to track design. Each circuit is lovingly crafted to provide just the right amount of twists, turns, and shortcuts for you to exploit (or get utterly lost in). It's like playing a game of Mario Kart, but with fewer blue shells and more, well, actual racing.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What about multiplayer?" Ah, yes! Horizon Chase 2 has got that covered too. The online component is seamless (read: doesn't crash on me constantly), and those rotating challenges? Genius. They add a healthy dose of variety to the proceedings, keeping things fresh even after hours of gameplay.

Of course, not everyone's on the same wavelength as I am – take, for instance, Gaming Nexus' review, where they lament that it's "relatively mindless racing." Um, isn't that the whole point? Like, I get it, some folks might want more complexity or simulation-like features (hello, Player 2!), but when I'm racing at top speed with my best buddy's ghosted lap times hovering above me, mindlessness is exactly what I'm looking for.

All in all, Horizon Chase 2 is a delightful romp that'll get your adrenaline pumping and your competitive juices flowing. So if you're in the market for some old-school arcade fun without the hassle of donkey-ing up quarters or searching high and low for those pesky collectibles, look no further!
